intro: Ouratea guriensis, commonly known as the Guriensis Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
